abstract: Ever wonder who buys those big, big TVs? Ever wonder if they ever get used?
snippet: Ever wonder who buys those big, big TVs? Ever wonder if they ever get used?
lead_paragraph: Televisions have gotten big. Very, very big. Perhaps too big to be practical. Over a lunch of veggie wraps and chicken sandwiches, Michael Kisch, director of consumer marketing for Cisco, told the tale of “The TV That Was Too Big.”
